text: I'm Matt gross the frugal traveler for
the new york times this summer I'm
embarking on the grand tour of Europe
over 12 weeks I'll seek out ancient
history and contemporary culture I'll
find cool hotels and eat memorable meals
and I'll stretch the US dollar to the
breaking point after three days in Dover
my adventure really truly finally began
I took to the Seas and headed across the
English Channel to Calais friends
frankly I was excited there I was
literally in the wake of the 18th
century grand tourists would I see what
they saw do what they did and more
importantly would I freeze to death
before I got there inside the ferry was
a kind of floating mall with shopping
restaurants a video arcade slot machines
and of course Benoit was a works in
contemporary art just outside Kelly if
you stay some someday and friends I
opening a new exhibition okay it's in
the map it's an American girl from
d'etre Marjorie and hotter yeah van the
heroine so it's American an invitation
to a gallery opening that's exactly what
the traditional grandtourist were
seeking and just as we arrived in Calais
to first however I had to walk through
town to my B&B the secluded Emmeline
this is just the kind of place i'm
always looking for beautiful comfortable
and quite affordable at 53 euros per
night I had the Venice room small but
cozy with a big soft bed and a view of
the garden actually the only thing that
worried me was that this might be the
nicest place I stay all summer long
as I took the free shuttle buses through
Calais I was feeling pretty cosmopolitan
it's in some ways a very nice city with
parks a grand City Hall and the famous
rodents statue of the burghers of calais
the burgers were six prominent Caillat
citizens who surrendered to England's
King Edward the third in order to halt
the siege of the city during the Hundred
Years War you find these burgers all
over the place like say at the Fine Art
Museum hey you know what goes well with
burgers fries Kelly's close to Belgium
which means they know exactly what to do
with potatoes
everywhere in calais i went i found our
teenis for instance jean-baptiste dumo a
painter and sculptor who poured me a
beer and showed me his studio it's a
sculpture that before I picked up
springs blocks this one's a brick a red
house brick jean-baptiste also showed me
his um unusual collections it's my cat
later I went to Ben woz gallery opening
in the town of San tome ayer the trip
was 14 euros there in back but easily
worth the expense
I arrived to find crowds packing the
gallery but I grabbed an artisanal beer
and tracked down the artist Marjorie van
hulle Turin inside you could see almost
nothing just this little window on the
sky the only sounds were those typical
northern French countryside sounds that
Marjorie had recorded a distillation of
the world surrounding us as wonderful as
all this are teenis was when I returned
home I had something else on my mom
calles refugee problem here less than
five minutes from the burghers of calais
is where hundreds of homeless refugees
from Africa Central Asia and the Middle
East gather every day for free meals
those with money may pay to be
trafficked to England but those without
are unlikely to win asylum on either
side of the channel even worse the
police frequently arrest them simply for
walking in public which doesn't mean the
refugees aren't friendly Roshan from Sri
Lanka and his friend Achmed from Somalia
let me back to their home in the place
people call the jungle their lives are
about as hard as you can imagine you get
food twice a day from the 10 polygonum
salam one take you poopoo at two o'clock
the evening and another food at six or
six o'clock and showers I'm I would not
reach out for now nine days have you
have you heard me talk with your family
no no I don't know where I they're there
because they want to leave behind me
it's another shift
I don't know they left they going to
India or they going eataly or they want
any other country I don't know I
couldn't contact them yet you have a
message for them I just want to tell my
mom and dad I am fine and surviving the
plight of my new friends really put the
Grand Tour in perspective whoo hello New
